activated-charcoal.description: Activated carbon powder from plant sources. Creates deep black to grey colours. Add at trace.
activated-charcoal.name: Activated charcoal

aloe-vera-powder.description: Concentrated Aloe barbadensis leaf juice powder (200:1). Moisturizing, anti-inflammatory. Low anthraquinone content (<50 ppm).
aloe-vera-powder.name: Aloe vera powder (200:1)

annatto-extract.description: Extract from Bixa orellana seeds. Contains bixin (oil-soluble) and norbixin (water-soluble). FDA-approved for cosmetics including eyes.
annatto-extract.name: Annatto extract

references.section: Color additive for cosmetics including eye area

apricot-shell-powder.description: Finely ground Prunus armeniaca seed shells. Particle size 10-177 microns.
apricot-shell-powder.name: Apricot shell powder

references.section: Apricot Kernel: Bioactivity, Characterization, Applications, and Health Attributes

beeswax.description: Natural wax from Apis mellifera. Increases bar hardness. Melt into oils before adding lye. Melting point 62-64°C.
beeswax.name: Beeswax (yellow)

references.section: Safety Assessment of Beeswax and Carnauba Wax

bentonite-clay.description: Montmorillonite-rich clay. Swells 12-15x when wet. Cation exchange capacity ~100 meq/100g. Higher absorption than kaolin.
bentonite-clay.name: Bentonite clay

references.section: Bentonite, Kaolin and Selected Clay Minerals, Section 2.2

bergamot-eo.description: Cold-pressed from Citrus bergamia peel, furocoumarin-free (FCF). Primary constituents: linalyl acetate (30-60%), limonene (25-50%).
bergamot-eo.name: Bergamot essential oil (FCF)

buttermilk-powder.description: Dried cultured buttermilk. Creates creamy lather. Lactic acid provides gentle exfoliation.
buttermilk-powder.name: Buttermilk powder

references.section: Safety Assessment of Bovine Milk Proteins and Protein Derivatives as Used in Cosmetics

calendula-petals.description: Dried Calendula officinalis flowers. Only botanical that retains colour in high pH soap. Use for decoration or oil infusion.
calendula-petals.name: Calendula petals (dried)

references.section: European Union herbal monograph on Calendula officinalis L., flos (Revision 1)

candelilla-wax.description: Plant-based wax from Euphorbiaceae species. Vegan alternative to beeswax. Melting point 68.5-72.5°C.
candelilla-wax.name: Candelilla wax

carnauba-wax.description: Hardest natural wax from Copernicia cerifera palm. Vegan. Brittle alone, combine with softer waxes. Melting point 82-85°C.
carnauba-wax.name: Carnauba wax

references.section: Safety Assessment of Beeswax and Carnauba Wax

cedarwood-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Cedrus atlantica wood. Primary constituents: alpha-cedrene, beta-cedrene, cedrol. Used to anchor lighter scents.
cedarwood-eo.name: Cedarwood essential oil (atlas)

chamomile-flowers.description: Dried Matricaria chamomilla flowers. Use for decoration (crispy-dry only) or tea infusion for lye. Turn brown over time in soap.
chamomile-flowers.name: Chamomile flowers (dried)

references.section: Amended Safety Assessment of Chamomilla recutita-Derived Ingredients as Used in Cosmetics

chromium-oxide-green.description: Chromium(III) oxide (Cr2O3). FDA-approved for cosmetics including eye area. Not approved for lips. Stable at high pH.
chromium-oxide-green.name: Chromium oxide green

clary-sage-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Salvia sclarea flowering tops. Primary constituents: linalyl acetate (56-78%), linalool (6.5-24%), sclareol.
clary-sage-eo.name: Clary sage essential oil

coffee-grounds.description: Spent Coffea arabica grounds. Used grounds preferred - softer, less colour bleed. Dry thoroughly before adding at trace.
coffee-grounds.name: Coffee grounds (used)

references.section: Coffea arabica: An Emerging Active Ingredient in Dermato-Cosmetic Applications

colloidal-oatmeal.description: Finely ground Avena sativa. FDA approved skin protectant. Add at trace. Particle size under 100 micrometers.
colloidal-oatmeal.name: Colloidal oatmeal

references.section: Skin protectant active ingredients - Colloidal oatmeal

eucalyptus-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Eucalyptus globulus leaves. Primary constituents: eucalyptol/1,8-cineole (70-90%), alpha-pinene (1-5%).
eucalyptus-eo.name: Eucalyptus essential oil (globulus)

frankincense-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Boswellia carterii resin. Primary constituents: alpha-pinene, limonene, alpha-thujene.
frankincense-eo.name: Frankincense essential oil (Boswellia carterii)

references.section: Review of the Chemical Composition, Pharmacological Effects, Pharmacokinetics, and Quality Control of Boswellia carterii

french-green-clay.description: Illite clay. Green colour from iron oxides and decomposed plant matter. Similar absorption properties to kaolin.
french-green-clay.name: French green clay (illite)

references.section: Bentonite, Kaolin and Selected Clay Minerals, Section 2.3

geranium-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Pelargonium graveolens leaves. Primary constituents: citronellol (21.9%), geraniol (11.1%), linalool (5.6%). Accelerates trace.
geranium-eo.name: Geranium essential oil (rose)

references.section: Chemical composition and biological activities of Pelargonium graveolens

goat-milk-powder.description: Full-cream powder from Capra aegagrus hircus. Rich in vitamins A, B6, B12, E. Reconstitute 8:1 water:powder.
goat-milk-powder.name: Goat milk powder

references.section: Safety Assessment of Bovine Milk Proteins and Protein Derivatives as Used in Cosmetics

grapefruit-eo.description: Cold-pressed from Citrus paradisi peel. Primary constituent: d-limonene (90-96%). Phototoxic in leave-on products; safe for rinse-off soap.
grapefruit-eo.name: Grapefruit essential oil (pink)

references.section: Chemical Profiling and Anti-Inflammatory Activities of Grapefruit Essential Oils

grapefruit-seed-extract.description: Extract from Citrus paradisi seeds. Antioxidant, extends shelf life. Not a broad-spectrum preservative. Verify purity.
grapefruit-seed-extract.name: Grapefruit seed extract (GSE)

references.section: Antimicrobial Efficacy of Grapefruit Seed Extract

honey.description: Natural humectant from Apis mellifera. Increases lather, adds natural sugars. Heats soap significantly - freeze after molding.
honey.name: Honey

indigo-powder.description: Natural indigo from Indigofera tinctoria. Contains indigotin. Not approved for eyes, lips, or nails.
indigo-powder.name: Indigo powder

references.section: Opinion on hair dye Indigofera tinctoria (SCCS/1615/20)

iron-oxide-black.description: Iron(II,III) oxide (Fe3O4). FDA approved for cosmetics including eye area. Stable in high pH. Use sparingly.
iron-oxide-black.name: Iron oxide black

iron-oxide-red.description: Iron(III) oxide (Fe2O3). FDA approved for cosmetics including eye area. Stable in high pH.
iron-oxide-red.name: Iron oxide red

iron-oxide-yellow.description: Iron(III) oxide hydroxide (FeO(OH)). FDA approved for cosmetics including eye area. Stable in high pH.
iron-oxide-yellow.name: Iron oxide yellow

jojoba-oil.description: Liquid wax ester (~97%) from Simmondsia chinensis seeds. Does not saponify. Add at trace as superfat for conditioning and stability.
jojoba-oil.name: Jojoba oil

references.section: Jojoba Oil: An Updated Comprehensive Review on Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Uses, and Toxicity

kaolin-clay.description: Hydrated aluminum silicate (Al2Si2O5(OH)4). Particle size 0.1-4 micrometers. Cation exchange capacity 2-10 meq/100g. Can absorb essential oils.
kaolin-clay.name: Kaolin clay (white)

references.section: Bentonite, Kaolin and Selected Clay Minerals, Section 2.1

lanolin.description: Wool wax from sheep (Ovis aries). Creates protective barrier. Add at trace or as superfat. May cause sensitivity in some users.
lanolin.name: Lanolin (anhydrous)

lavender-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Lavandula angustifolia flowers. Primary constituents: linalool (25-45%), linalyl acetate (25-45%).
lavender-eo.name: Lavender essential oil

lemongrass-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Cymbopogon flexuosus or C. citratus. Primary constituent: citral (70-85%).
lemongrass-eo.name: Lemongrass essential oil

lime-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Citrus aurantifolia peel. Primary constituent: d-limonene (~50%). Distilled version is non-phototoxic.
lime-eo.name: Lime essential oil (distilled)

may-chang-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Litsea cubeba fruits. Primary constituent: citral (>75%). Better scent retention than lemongrass.
may-chang-eo.name: May chang essential oil (Litsea cubeba)

mica-iron-oxide.description: Mica coated with iron oxides (≤55% by weight). Creates bronze, copper, gold effects. Color-stable in high pH soap.
mica-iron-oxide.name: Mica (iron oxide coated)

mica-pearl-titanium.description: Natural or synthetic mica coated with titanium dioxide (TiO2). Creates interference/pearl effects. Color-stable in CP soap.
mica-pearl-titanium.name: Mica pearl (titanium dioxide)

patchouli-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Pogostemon cablin leaves. Primary constituent: patchoulol (25-35%). Used to anchor lighter scents.
patchouli-eo.name: Patchouli essential oil

peppermint-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Mentha piperita leaves. Primary constituents: menthol (30-55%), menthone (14-32%).
peppermint-eo.name: Peppermint essential oil

poppy-seeds.description: Whole seeds from Papaver somniferum. Does not create micro-tears.
poppy-seeds.name: Poppy seeds

pumice-powder.description: Volcanic rock powder (amorphous aluminum silicate). 80-200 mesh size. Non-crystalline structure, no respirable silica.
pumice-powder.name: Pumice powder (fine)

rose-petals.description: Dried Rosa spp. petals. Turn brown in CP soap due to high pH. Add only to top of cured soap for decoration.
rose-petals.name: Rose petals (dried)

references.section: Safety Assessment of Rosa damascena-Derived Ingredients as Used in Cosmetics

rosemary-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Rosmarinus officinalis leaves and flowering tops. Primary constituents: 1,8-cineole, camphor, alpha-pinene.
rosemary-eo.name: Rosemary essential oil

references.section: Evaluation of Marketed Rosemary Essential Oils

rosemary-oleoresin.description: Oil-soluble extract from Rosmarinus officinalis leaves. Retards rancidity. Rich in carnosic acid (7%+). Add to oils before mixing.
rosemary-oleoresin.name: Rosemary oleoresin extract (ROE)

sandalwood-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Santalum album heartwood. Primary constituents: alpha-santalol, beta-santalol (>90%). Sustainable sourcing critical.
sandalwood-eo.name: Sandalwood essential oil (East Indian)

references.section: Sandalwood Album Oil as Botanical Therapeutic in Dermatology

sea-salt-fine.description: Fine-grain sea salt. Rich in minerals (magnesium, calcium, potassium). Above 3% may inhibit lather.
sea-salt-fine.name: Sea salt (fine grain)

silk-amino-acids.description: Hydrolyzed silk protein peptides (MW ~300-1000 Da). Enhances lather creaminess. Rich in glycine, alanine, serine. Add to cooled lye water.
silk-amino-acids.name: Silk amino acids (hydrolyzed silk)

references.section: Safety Assessment of Silk Protein Ingredients

spearmint-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Mentha spicata leaves. Primary constituent: R-(-)-carvone (50-80%). Less intense than peppermint.
spearmint-eo.name: Spearmint essential oil

spirulina-powder.description: Dried blue-green algae (Limnospira spp.) powder. pH-stable natural colourant. Rich in phycocyanin.
spirulina-powder.name: Spirulina powder

references.section: Spirulina as Key Ingredient in Eco-Friendly Cosmetics

sodium-lactate.description: Sodium salt of lactic acid (C3H5NaO3). Add to cooled lye water before combining with oils. Reduces unmoulding time.
sodium-lactate.name: Sodium lactate

sugar.description: Sucrose (C12H22O11). Dissolve in water portion before adding lye. Increases lather volume.
sugar.name: Sugar (sucrose)

sweet-orange-eo.description: Cold-pressed from Citrus sinensis peel. Primary constituent: d-limonene (93-96%). Oxidizes readily; use with antioxidants.
sweet-orange-eo.name: Sweet orange essential oil

references.section: Safety Assessment of Citrus-Derived Peel Oils

table-salt.description: Sodium chloride (NaCl). Dissolve in water portion before adding lye. Increases hardness. Above 3% may inhibit lather.
table-salt.name: Salt (sodium chloride)

tea-tree-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Melaleuca alternifolia leaves. Primary constituents: terpinen-4-ol (30-48%), gamma-terpinene (10-28%).
tea-tree-eo.name: Tea tree essential oil

tussah-silk.description: Natural silk fibers from wild Antheraea moths. Dissolves in hot lye water (170-190°F). Increases lather creaminess.
tussah-silk.name: Tussah silk fibers

references.section: Safety Assessment of Silk Protein Ingredients as Used in Cosmetics

titanium-dioxide.description: Titanium(IV) oxide (TiO2). FDA approved for cosmetics. Creates opaque white. Stable in high pH.
titanium-dioxide.name: Titanium dioxide

turmeric-powder.description: Ground rhizome of Curcuma longa. Contains curcumin (90%+ curcuminoids). FDA-approved for food but not cosmetics.
turmeric-powder.name: Turmeric powder

references.section: Color additive exempt from certification for food use

ultramarine-blue.description: Synthetic sodium aluminum sulfosilicate. FDA-approved for cosmetics including eye area. Stable at high pH.
ultramarine-blue.name: Ultramarine blue

ultramarine-pink.description: Sodium aluminum sulfosilicate violet/pink. FDA-approved for cosmetics including eyes. Not permitted in lip products.
ultramarine-pink.name: Ultramarine pink

vetiver-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Vetiveria zizanioides roots. Primary constituents: khusimol, alpha-vetivone, beta-vetivone. Anchors lighter scents.
vetiver-eo.name: Vetiver essential oil

vitamin-e-tocopherol.description: Mixed tocopherols (alpha, beta, gamma, delta). Antioxidant to prevent oil oxidation. Add to oils before mixing.
vitamin-e-tocopherol.name: Vitamin E (mixed tocopherols)

ylang-ylang-eo.description: Steam-distilled from Cananga odorata flowers. Primary constituents: linalool, benzyl acetate, benzyl benzoate. Moderate sensitization risk.
ylang-ylang-eo.name: Ylang ylang essential oil (complete)

references.section: Registration Dossier ylang ylang flower oil

zinc-oxide.description: Zinc oxide (ZnO). FDA-approved for cosmetics including eye area. Creates opaque white.
zinc-oxide.name: Zinc oxide
